speaker: Catacombs Gate
lines: Steps sweat old cold; torches wag their tongues and say nothing helpful.
A gate of bone kisses sits ajar in a way that feels deliberate.
On the lintel, names braided with dates: births that learned to end politely.
Air moves like a careful hand over a child's fever.
A trail of dust prints shows bare feet that forgot to stop printing.
Salt crusts the threshold; someone remembered a rule.
A bell pull hangs, unconnected to anything you can see.
The city above speaks loud; the city below expects whispers.

choices.text: Pull the bell and announce yourself.
Step over the salt without scuffing it.
Go back toward the plaza light.
